snippet: The special prosecutor in the Trayvon Martin shooting, who said she would release new information by Friday, is facing an exercise unlikely to satisfy everyone.
abstract: Angela B Corey, special prosecutor in the Trayvon Martin shooting, is facing a task unlikely to satisfy everyone; she must choose between finding criminal charges that can be proved beyond a reasonable doubt, or deciding that George Zimmerman's account of defending himself in face of deadly force places him within the protects of Florida's Stand Your Ground law.

byline.contributor: Serge F. Kovaleski contributed reporting from Orlando, Fla., and Lizette Alvarez from Miami.

lead_paragraph: The special prosecutor in the Trayvon Martin shooting, who said she would release new information by Friday, is facing an exercise unlikely to satisfy everyone.

headline.seo: Tough Choice Looms in Trayvon Martin Killing
headline.main: In Martin Case, Tough Choice Looms for Prosecutor
headline.print_headline: Tough Decision Looms For Florida Prosecutor
